recommendations.title: Does Antimatter Fall Down or up? We Now Have a Definitive Answer.
recommendations.excerpt: Gravity wins—this time around.

recommendations.title: Why Etsy Is a Financial Lifeline for Artisans in Ukraine
recommendations.excerpt: Ukraine-based Etsy shops have long had the highest sales rates in the world. The war has made those shops more critical than ever.

recommendations.title: They Studied Dishonesty. Was Their Work a Lie?
recommendations.excerpt: Dan Ariely and Francesca Gino became famous for their research into why we bend the truth. Now they’ve both been accused of fabricating data.

recommendations.title: Gandhi’s vision of a constitution was imperfect, but is India paying the price for neglecting it?
recommendations.excerpt: He envisaged self-governing and largely self-sufficient village republics and felt that concentrating power would violate democratic principles.

recommendations.title: The Iran Protests One Year Later Roya Piraei's Photo Made Her an Icon
recommendations.excerpt: Hundreds of protesters have likely been killed since the most recent wave of demonstrations began one year ago. The daughter of one victim cut off her hair, and the image went viral. She immediately had to leave Iran and now lives in exile in Britain.

recommendations.title: Lego Is a Company Haunted by Its Own Plastic
recommendations.excerpt: Lego has built an empire out of plastic. It was always thus. The bricks weren’t originally made from wood, or metal, or some other material.

recommendations.title: 5 Ways to Work Remotely (and Effectively) for the Long Haul
recommendations.excerpt: Despite return-to-office mandates, workers have made it clear that remote work isn't going anywhere. Here's how to make the most of it while keeping your boss (and yourself) happy.

recommendations.title: Famine in the 21st Century Must be a Red Line. Here's What We Can Do .
recommendations.excerpt: Famine is back and the threat is real. And not just in one or two countries, but in multiple regions. The good news is that we have the resources and skills to make famine a thing of the past. But past strategies won’t work.

recommendations.title: How Three Bros in Their Thirties Turned Their Animal Obsession into a Binge-Worthy Podcast
recommendations.excerpt: Nearly half a million listeners download ‘Tooth and Claw’ each month. Can the show also help save the animals it profiles?

recommendations.title: So Much for ‘Learn to Code’
recommendations.excerpt: In the age of AI, computer science is no longer the safe major.

recommendations.title: What Writers and Editors Read Last Month
recommendations.excerpt: Explore your favorite writers’ Pockets to discover their recent reads—and why you might enjoy them too.

recommendations.title: Shreya Roy Chowdhury's Art Extraordinarily Captures Bonds Of Sisterhood & Femininity
recommendations.excerpt: Shreya’s artworks are a celebration of everyday Indian life.

recommendations.title: In Defense of the Rat
recommendations.excerpt: Rats are less pestilent and more lovable than we think. Can we learn to live with them?

recommendations.title: Why Do We Forget So Many of Our Dreams?
recommendations.excerpt: We only remember a fraction of our dreams, and even those slip away if we don’t try to remember them—here’s why

recommendations.title: The Joy of Plant-Based Eating
recommendations.excerpt: Chef Daniel Humm offers advice for those of us who want to focus on plant-based eating.

recommendations.title: India’s pickle people: Decades-old culinary heirlooms, nostalgia
recommendations.excerpt: A self-proclaimed pickle enthusiast explores India’s familial pickle-making traditions, which stretch back generations.

recommendations.title: The Serpentine Career of Loïe Fuller
recommendations.excerpt: Artists and critics saw the Serpentine as a glorious rebellion against the onrush of modernity.

recommendations.title: The Wonders
recommendations.excerpt: Sites in Ohio may be as vital to human history as the pyramids. Why have they been ignored for so long?

recommendations.title: How Gareth Edwards’ Sci-Fi Opus ‘The Creator’ Achieved Blockbuster Scale at a Fraction of the Cost
recommendations.excerpt: As costs spiral upward for production infrastructure, visual effects and good old fashioned star wattage, blockbuster budgets tend to be one of the closely guarded secrets in Hollywood.

recommendations.title: How Instagram Ruined Personal Style
recommendations.excerpt: Resisting trends is difficult, GQ columnist Chris Black writes, but that is exactly what the menswear icons on your Explore page once did—and the only move of theirs that you must emulate.

recommendations.title: Sam Altman Is the Oppenheimer of Our Age
recommendations.excerpt: OpenAI’s CEO thinks he knows our future. What do we know about him?

recommendations.title: How to Deep Clean Your Kitchen Cabinets
recommendations.excerpt: Even if you keep your kitchen relatively clean—wiping down countertops and tables, vacuuming the floor, and keeping the sink area as tidy as possible—grease and grime from regular cooking is going to build up over time.

recommendations.title: Can India-Europe corridor rival China's Belt and Road?
recommendations.excerpt: A new transport corridor announced on the sidelines of the G20 summit in Delhi will become the basis of world trade for hundreds of years to come, Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi said in a recent radio address. Can it really?

recommendations.excerpt: Is there a power imbalance between wearers and nonwearers in mixed company?

recommendations.title: 14 movies that will dominate Oscar season 2024
recommendations.excerpt: From devastating gay love stories to raucous and colourful campus movies.

recommendations.title: How A 19th-Century Bengali Doctor Built The World's Largest Ayurvedic Company
recommendations.excerpt: From its humble beginnings in a small manufacturing plant in Kolkata, Dabur now operates in 12 locations in India and eight overseas.

recommendations.title: More than half of Indian employees are logging off from work exhausted
recommendations.excerpt: The mental health of Indians is keeping over half of them from performing effectively at work.

recommendations.title: “Opposites attract” is a myth: You likely share many traits with your partner
recommendations.excerpt: While "opposites attract" is true for magnets, research shows that this is usually not true for long-term relationships.

recommendations.title: Martin Scorsese: “I Have To Find Out Who The Hell I Am.”
recommendations.excerpt: Now 80, the legendary director is on one of the most creative runs of his career— and consumed by the challenges (and opportunities) of all that he has left to do.

recommendations.title: India ‘doctor’ keeps fountain pens flowing with care, devotion to tradition
recommendations.excerpt: India has a rich history of fountain pen-making and vintage shops that repair pens of all types for enthusiasts from around the world.
